comment: She was great! Class was asynch, but all lectures on YouTube. I started taking notes for the first 3 chapters before the class started, which I highly recommend. Her lectures were very straightforward/easy to understand. Chemistry can be tough, so put in the work, but tons of worksheets and scheduled review times with the teacher are available.

The class was entirely online and asynchronous but she was easy to reach and communicated well with her students. She makes it very clear what you need to understand for assessments and provides lots of practice so if you put in the work, the class won't be difficult at all. She also really helps to explain the more complex topics in an easy way.

She is one of my favorite professors. Connects well with students. I did not use the textbook once; everything you need to know is covered in class. She goes slow and only talks about what is important. It is a concept-heavy class, so there is not much to memorize, and she has us do problems in class so we understand everything.

Dr. Klingler-Maffe is a very gifted teacher. Her tests were straight forward and the class wasn't too difficult. However, Chemistry is an involved, challenging class no matter who your professor is. Be ready to put in some work, and you will do well with this awesome professor.
Best professor! Definitely take!

Chemistry is a difficult class. Unless your major requires it- take a different science class. With that said, she is a great professor. The class is hard because the subject matter is hard, not because she is a bad teacher. She answers questions and grades fairly. She is really nice but sometimes dismissive to students, especially around test time
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Shes the hardest professor when it comes to exams. Everything feels rushed. Lectures are recorded which helps a lot but you will have to spend HOURS studying to pass the class!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: says you wont pass the class unless you study 20+ hours a week. she circles info on a powerpoint for 50 minutes and then says go study for 20 hours. class work and study worksheets are easybut test is different level hard. DO NOT TAKE HER ONLINE ! good reviews are from in person because online shes terrible unless you wanna spend all week on chem

I LOVE Prof Klingler! If I could give you one piece of advice it would be to show up to the online lecture. I was so scared for chemistry online but she made it much better. She is so thorough in her teaching and really understanding. She will correct you when wrong but its only constructive. She made me want to sign up for 1212 bc she was amazing

She was ok, but I felt like she went through things way to quickly and the tests were often way more detailed than the content covered in the lectures. Great choice if you're decent at chem and are willing to put in the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: TAKE HER. Guaranteed best Chem professor. She made me understand chemistry. The tests are hard but chem is tuff so that's expected. Had online hw due before each test but easy to get a good grade on. she really cares about her students. we had a combined groupme for all 200+ chem students and she always answered every question. this class was best
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Maffe is one of the best teachers I have ever had. You have to study but that comes with any class. You have to go to class and do given worksheets to do well on tests. During this pandemic, she is understanding and accommodating to students. She provides pre-recorded lectures and She drops the lowest quiz and test grade, take her!!

Is willing to help students. Actually listens to feedback and will adjust accordingly. Lecture heavy yet stops for any questions. Lots of practice problems to help. Homework for each unit yet is not long. Drops lowest test. Helps you succeed. Can be sarcastic if you ask repetitive questions. Overall makes chem a bit easier to understand and get.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Klingler is quite off-putting and was only kind half the time. She was really hard to reach, in my experience at least, and so I was unable to get help when I was lost. It was difficult. Many times, directions were unclear and when she did respond, she was extremely vague and unhelpful. I would take someone else who is willing to help.

Dr Maffe is soo sweet. But sweet won't make you pass the class. Though we don't get as much homework, her tests are super hard because she wants you to think of things in a conceptual way. If you're the type of learner that likes things straight to the point without a ton of deep explanations, then do not take her. Way too hard for no reason.

As long as you participate and make sure your lab notebook looks like the example she gives, you should be fine. The lab final was straightforward as long as you understand how to use the equations we used in lab to be able to show work. She gives really good pre-lab lectures and has a lab assistant to help you through out the lab.

Dr. Klingler is one of the most rude and arrogant professors I've ever taken. It's either her way or the highway. She will tell you to do one thing and then when you do it, she'll switch up and say it's wrong and then she'll take off petty points. She is so unreasonable. She is disrespectful and unreachable. She has no respect for her students.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I've had Dr. Maffe for chem 1 & 2, and she is a really great chemistry professor! She really knows how to teach! She tries to make the class fun which can be fun in a hard class. She is SUPER dedicated to teaching chemistry and always goes above and beyond by posting recorded lectures late at night, worksheets, and provides a groupme. DO THE WS!

she is a very good chem teacher but if you don't pay attention you will fail. Try not to skip because she goes through a lot of material in each class. Online textbook and she does mini quizzes in class but she doesn't take them for a grade, just attendance. Very good powerpoints and nice tests. She is nice and funny, not your usual professor
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She is an amazing teacher and gives opportunities for extra credit by class participation. HW is 10%, Quizzes and participation is 10%, the 5 exams are 60% total and the final is 20%. She makes videos of all the lectures and gives you access to her powerpoints. There is also review questions throughout the class to practice topics on.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: The tests are thoroughly covered by her lectures during the semester. Puts recorded lectures and practice tests online ( practice tests usually a few days before the test).

If you're not science/math inclined, rethink this. Lots of homework/participation grades to cushion you, but the tests are hard. Several group quizzes. Snappy sometimes, but tries her best to explain things throughly. Great powerpoints, prerecorded lectures, and extra practice worksheets. If I wasn't bad at chemistry, I'd take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Literally just awful dont waste your time I was out for a whole week for medical issues and shes wouldnt even let me make up a test. Honestly just find another teacher worst chem teacher ever
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great trof, but chem2 is super tough & she won't go easy on you. I study my ass off for weeks before a test & got A's, but I know others who tried harder & still failed. Attendance for a grade, lots of HW, posts lectures online, drops lowest test. If you struggle in math/science, rethink. If you did good in chem 1, willing to work hard, youll be ok
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I've never failed a class in my life, but Klinger might be the exception She gives you fifteen question tests and three of them are free response. She grades by few things for sure. I have created a 30 page study guide, attended all the classes, done all hw, & SI sess. only to get a 60 on the test. If I can do 1 thing right, its to warn others.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Clearly cares about her students and wants them to succeed, posts the powerpoints/notes online, posts recorded lectures that are very helpful, posts practice questions and practice tests. She gives you all the materials to succeed you just have to put in the work and study and do practice problems and there's no reason not to get an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is the most dedicated teacher Ive ever had. Chemistry is overall a tough class but she does daily participation grades so as long as you show up you will benefit from it. She is very clear about what exactly she teaches will be on the test. The hardest part is homework but dont procrastinate and you will be fine!!

Dr. Maffe is one of the best professors at KSU. If you have to change your schedule to take her class, do it. She's honestly your best bet to pass CHEM 1 and 2, and she genuinely cares about her students.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Klingler-Maffe is very intelligent in the field of chemistry, so she often provided different angles of attack towards difficult problems. Outside of class, she provides many notes, worksheets, and online lectures that can further help in understanding chemistry. She is also accessible for further questions, and is very involved with her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: I love Dr. Klingler-Maffe! I respect her so much. She really cares about students and wants us to do well! She has very helpful online videos to watched before class. Her lectures are so well prepared and class is straight forward and predictable. She explains VERY WELL. She's the solid, trustworthy Chem professor you want! I'll miss her!

THE BEST professor I've ever had at KSU. She had a flipped classroom style which greatly benefitted my learning, allowing me to complete lectures at my own pace. Her lectures are also available on youtube. Highly recommend even if you struggle with chemistry. I nearly failed chem 1 with Monroe and made a 93 on one of the exams in here bc of Maffe.

Dr Maffe is the best professor I have ever had. She cares so much and genuinely enjoys helping her students learn. The class itself is difficult simply because of the material but if you go to office hours and show her that you take initiative she will do so much to help you. TAKE HER CLASS!! I wouldnt recommend any professor over her!!

I took her for Chem I and now Chem II and she is absolutely amazing. The most caring college professor I've had. She's funny and her lectures are super good and not too boring. Just pay attention in class and study a little bit and you'll be fine. Rearrange your schedule to take her.

Great Prof, difficult tests. Professor Klingler is a great professor, and I would recommend taking her class, but only if you're willing to work hard for a good grade. I had a 45 minute block with her 3 times a week and finishing the test on time was extremely hard unless you know all the information like the back of your hand.

This was my first year in college, and she was the best professor I have had thus far. If you have an option to change your schedule, DO IT! Her class is easy and she really cares for her students. She is very accessible outside of class. It is somewhat mandatory to go to class, but she does not care if you are late. Test are easy, just study notes
She speaks so fast it hard to understand whats going on. There are so many things you have to do just to get a passing grade on tests its ridiculous. Shes a funny professor who likes joking around.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you have to move your schedule around to take her, DO IT. She is the only teacher I've ever taken that has made chemistry easy to understand. She is caring and will do everything she can to see you pass. We used TopHat instead of textbook, so attendance is mandatory and is averaged into your grade. Easy A if you do the work

She's a fairly good professor, very nice and not at all harsh. She gives test retakes but you're better off just doing well the first time around because the retakes are twice is hard as the first test! Very patient!

I had Dr. Maffe for my chemistry 1151 class and she was great. She explains things well and provides lots of resources to help you study (optional worksheets, prerecorded lectures etc.) As long as you actually put in the work you will be alright. I recommend watching her prerecorded lectures and reading her textbook to make sure you do well.

Dr. Maffe really CARES about her students and wants them to do well. She allowed test retakes, and would allow us to take a quiz later if we missed it. She is an extremely kind lady, and her lectures really make sense. Do not take any other chem professor! I am usually extremely bad at math and science, but Dr. Maffe made it easy!
One of the best professors I have had. Multiple choice exams with free response and partial credit. Actually cares about her students if you put in the work. 10/10 would recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: As a regular chem prof, she is amazing. I took her for AMP (advanced majors program) and was much more difficult than it should've been. You have to watch the prerecorded lectures before and she does problems the next class. In her regular classes you watch the lectures and she explains the lectures and works problems. DO NOT TAKE AMP CHEM WITH HER
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Definitely one of the best chem professors at KSU. Chemistry can be a difficult subject, but she goes out of her way to help you do well. Provides guided notes to go with the lecture PowerPoints, posts video lectures on YouTube, posts tons of practice worksheets online, and even has a class GroupMe so you can ask her questions. Great professor!

Take her class or else you WILL regret it. She cares a lot if you genuinely try which you have to for chemistry. She is one of the best in the chemistry department at KSU- she will help you anyway she can& posts her lectures on Youtube for people outside of her class to watch too. Mastering chemistry help &is always available on groupme. Love her
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I had Dr. Maffe (Klingler) in high school and again at KSU. She is one of the kindest and most caring professors at Kennesaw State. Having professors that genuinely want you to succeed and care about your performance is exceedingly rare in college, but she's one of the best. Attending class will get you SO far, even if you think you don't need to.

You have to watch pre recorded lectures with questions embedded into them and then (almost) every class you have a exit quiz on the material that is graded. Tests are half MC and half free response. If you go to class she may  give you bonus points, but if you want an A go to SI sessions.

I absolutely loved her. She does a flipped classroom style and a lot of people don't like it, but I found it exceedingly effective. Show up to her class, not only because of the in class quizzes, but she will typically tell you what kind of questions will be on the test. She will also occasionally give you a bonus point or two just for showing up.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was a nice professor but her tests were difficult, half MC half free response and she is picky with grading. She has a reverse classroom where the lecture videos are done outside of the class and you practice inside, if you don't like teaching yourself then don't take!

She was okay. It was ran like a high school class rather than college. I personally didn't have time for busy work. Most of the time class doesn't get out on time, which is annoying when you have a class that starts 10 minutes after. Make sure you have good wifi, plenty of technology, desire to spend money on extra online programs required.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: BEST CHEM TEACHER EVER! She works through problems in class to make sure you understand it. We view lectures before class on EDPuzzle for participation points. Technology is used heavily in this class for exit quizzes and online homework, but the exit quizzes can easily be accessed on any phone, which is what I do. TAKE HER CLASS SHE IS THE BEST!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is so funny, and her lectures are fun. She assigns videos to watch before class so that when we get to class, we kind of summarize and just do practice worksheets. At first I thought it was busy work, but it really helps you understand the material, and in class you can have a clear explanation without cutting into lecture time.

Don't take this class if you don't have a laptop to bring to class. I personally do not prefer this teacher. Her lectures are very unorganized and scattered (asks students to solve problems for her) You learn most material on her HOURS of homework which is aggravating to come to class for a dumb exit quiz. Excessive work and dedication  A

Dr. Klingler is amazing! The first time I took chemistry I made a D, but with her I understood everything right off the bat. I've taken chem 1211 and now 1212 with her. Her tests are straightforward & her teaching style is great. She assigns hw through mastering chemistry but only 10-12 problems. If chemistry isn't your strong area I recommend her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Very good professor, makes online videos for chem that are very helpful. It is a decent amount of work but she does give extra credit and helps as much as she can. Good idea to go to class as much as possible because she gives exit quizzes. Even though these don't count for much it's still better to go to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Best professor I have taken so far.  She does a flipped style classroom with video lectures as homework and then problem solving and chapter reviews in class.  She was very organized and really wants to help prepare you for tests. I am taking her again for Chem 1212!

She put lectures online so you can do practice work in class. I'm really bad at Chem but she is a great teacher and is willing too help. She gives a quiz almost at the end of every class so show up. 4 test, 4 mastering chem homework, lots of quizzes and 1 final. She really cares and will stay after to help you if you need it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: Super super nice professor! Probably my fave prof i took at ksu. She is very good at explaining the labs before class and always always helps you! I made almost all As on the lab reports because I kept asking her questions and went to her office hours. Love her!! she's so sweeet. But be careful she grades harshly sometimes!

Dr. Klinger-Maffe is amazing! I took chem 1211 with a different prof and made a D and retook with klinger. She made it so easy to understand! I didn't have any chem education prior to this. She is very good at explaining & makes herself accessible. She has a short in class skills check every day which makes attendance mandatory but is very helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the kindest teachers i've ever had. She uploads lessons to youtube, puts a lot of effort towards helping you during office hours, and is very approachable and funny. She even helped me with chemistry lecture, despite not being my lecture teacher. I made an A on each lab report by going to office hours almost each week. I highly recommend her

Never have I met a professor that so blatantly wants her students to fail. Nearly done with the semester and she changes our participation quizzes to be graded for correctness. Previously taught high school, gives +1 extra credit but only to those who volunteer to do problems on board or ask a question she cannot answer then must present to class.
Dr. Maffe is the BEST professor I have ever had. She really cares for her students and she is so helpful. If you get the chance to take her, you must take her!!!! She is AWESOME!!!!!!!

Best prof I've ever taken. Extremely helpful and she makes prerecorded lectures that you can watch online. They help immensely for tests and quizzes. 4 tests, drops 1. I would recommend reading the sections in the book before class, although not required, as well as watching the prerecorded lectures. She really wants you to do well.

This professor honestly cares about her students. Always willing to help. This course has a large amount of homework, both online and prerecorded lectures that you must watch and quiz over before the next class. In class, there is a small daily quiz. If you don't keep up with the lectures, you'll stay behind, so keep that in mind.

Dr Maffe cares about her students more than any teacher I have met. A bunch of us would stay after lecture and she would answer any and all questions we had. She does a flipped classroom style. Her tests are straightforward. Do her wksts and you'll do fine. You will need to attend class to be able to understand what's going on. I love her

She is very willing to help, as long as you make an appointment or can make her office hours. Passionate about her teaching. She posts pre-recorded lectures for you to watch before class. If you understand what is going on you will do well. Its very easy to get lost, and everything builds on another so get help if you don't understand something.

She goes by Dr. Maffe. This is my absolute favorite professor at KSU. She's funny and truly cares about her students. Yes, she is a little bit tough, but she's always open to talk to and get help. I would recommend her 100%.

She goes by Maffe now. Professor Maffe is just like the other lab teachers. Pre lab lectures are somewhat helpful and very repetitive. Explanations aren't always clear. Grading criteria is very vague. Takes off points if you follow the manual and not her. She doesn't give 100%'s on labs. She also makes you do long conclusions which are repetitive.

She goes by Dr. Maffe now but she is great. She makes the prelab lectures easy to understand and is there to answer questions if you need it. She's so funny and gets along with her class very well. She'll probably play music for the class if it helps. However, if you don't act right, she will not let it slide completely. I recommend her.
